1e5e5608-463d-4082-9695-5f8130354c30.description: Earners of the Student Leader: Level 1 badge have demonstrated leadership through holding a position of leadership within the School. They have taken an active lead in making a positive and meaningful contribution to the school. They have demonstrated commitment to their role, contributed to raising the interest and participation of other students, and inspired and empowered others to realise their own potential. The earner has completed their term as a Student Leader within one school year.
1e5e5608-463d-4082-9695-5f8130354c30.name: Student Leader: Level 1

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities
alignments.description: This badge aligns with standards from the Australian Curriculum - General Capabilities; Personal and Social Responsibility.

badge_template_activities.title: Awarded a formal leadership role within the School, or voluntarily takes an informal role in a school-endorsed area. This might include Tutor Captains, Shine Ambassadors, Peer Support Leaders, SRC Representatives or participants in YLead Program.
Demonstrates development of leadership skills over the course of their term.
Completes a self-reflection that demonstrates what has been learned and achieved.

f478315b-4574-4331-a1e5-c917869f0697.description: Earners of the Student Leader: Level 2 badge have demonstrated leadership through holding a position of leadership within the School. They have taken an active lead in making a positive and meaningful contribution to the school. They have demonstrated commitment to their role, contributed to raising the interest and participation of other students and inspired and empowered others to realise their own potential. The earner has completed two School years in which they have held a leadership role.
f478315b-4574-4331-a1e5-c917869f0697.name: Student Leader: Level 2

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities
alignments.description: This badge aligns with standards from the Australian Curriculum - General Capabilities; Personal and Social Responsibility.

badge_template_activities.title: Student Leader: Level 1
Awarded a formal leadership role within the School, or voluntarily takes the lead in a School endorsed area. This might include Tutor Captains, Shine Ambassadors, Peer Support Leaders.
Completed two School years in which they have undertaken a leadership role.
Demonstrates development of leadership skills over the course of their term.
Completes a self reflection that demonstrates what has been learned and achieved. The application includes a reference from a teacher.

f1d084c7-6935-4912-912b-ddee18095951.description: Earners of the Community Service Level 1 badge have contributed to the success of the Lauriston Girls’ School Service and Action Plan. They have participated in School endorsed service activities, modelling positive behaviour and demonstrating empathy.
f1d084c7-6935-4912-912b-ddee18095951.name: Community Service: Level 1

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities
alignments.description: This badge aligns with standards from the Australian Curriculum - General Capabilities; Personal and Social Responsibility.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 10 hours of community service which have been endorsed by the School.
Complete a self-reflection on the one or more service activities they have participated in which have been endorsed by the School.

74aa37e4-3622-449d-b36f-846545af00f7.description: Earners of the Community Service Level 2 badge have demonstrated a commitment to the success of the Lauriston Girls’ School Service and Action Plan. They have participated in School endorsed service activities, modelling positive behaviour and demonstrating empathy.
74aa37e4-3622-449d-b36f-846545af00f7.name: Community Service: Level 2

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities
alignments.description: This badge aligns with standards from the Australian Curriculum - General Capabilities; Personal and Social Responsibility.

badge_template_activities.title: Community Service: Level 1
Complete 15 hours of community service which have been endorsed by the School.
Complete a self-reflection on the one or more service activities they have participated in, which has been endorsed by the School.

a38bd033-b1f4-4674-a71e-b19cd829471c.description: Earners of the Leadership: Community Service Badge have proven commitment to ensuring the well-being of others and have taken an active lead in the implementation of the Lauriston Girls' School - Service and Action Plan. They have demonstrated effective planning, communication, and mobilisation of people through leadership of service activities, inspiring and empowering others to realise their own potential.
a38bd033-b1f4-4674-a71e-b19cd829471c.name: Leadership: Community Service

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities
alignments.description: This badge aligns with standards from the Australian Curriculum - General Capabilities; Critical and Creative Thinking, Personal and Social Responsibility.

badge_template_activities.title: Community Service: Level 3
Attend a planning session to discuss an identified opportunity in the community. Discuss the desired outcomes and ideate a solution.
Initiate a school endorsed community service activity, and take on the leadership of a group of students who will complete the community service project over an extended period of time.
Present to students and teachers about their community service project, demonstrating the elements of the project and the benefits for the recipients of the activity.

Appropriately document the project and provide evidence of the impact the activity had on self, participants and recipients of the service. Complete a self-reflection activity to critically examine what has been learned and achieved through the process.
Act as a mentor for one or more students who are working towards achievement of the Community Service Level 3 badge.

caa8099a-4591-4761-86fb-a1c9c9cf8fa8.description: Earners of the Student Leadership badge have demonstrated leadership through holding a position of leadership within the School. They have taken an active lead in making a positive and meaningful contribution to our school. They have demonstrated commitment to their role, effective planning and organisation and communication skills, contributed to raising the interest and participation of other students, and inspired and empowered others to realise their own potential.
caa8099a-4591-4761-86fb-a1c9c9cf8fa8.name: Leadership: Student Leader

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities
alignments.description: This badge aligns with standards from the Australian Curriculum - General Capabilities; Critical and Creative Thinking, Personal and Social Responsibility.

badge_template_activities.title: Student Leader: Level 3
Awarded a formal leadership role in Years 11 or 12 for the period of at least one full School year or has taken on the leadership of a school activity over an extended period of time.
Act as a mentor for one or more students who are working towards achievement of Level 3.
Initiate and Lead a project within the school for students focused on promoting engagement with their portfolio.
Completed a self-reflection on their role as a leader, discussing the impact they've had on others,  impact on self, and the skills they have developed.

c84a1c0c-89dd-4861-aa94-46ad8b5f7b77.description: Earners of the Community Service Level 3 badge have demonstrated a thorough commitment to the success of the Lauriston Girls’ School Service and Action Plan. They have participated in School endorsed service activities, modelling positive behaviour, demonstrating empathy and helping others to realise their potential.
c84a1c0c-89dd-4861-aa94-46ad8b5f7b77.name: Community Service: Level 3

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities
alignments.description: This badge aligns with standards from the Australian Curriculum - General Capabilities; Critical and Creative Thinking, Personal and Social Responsibility.

badge_template_activities.title: Community Service: Level 2
Complete 20 hours of community service which have been endorsed by the School.

Undertake at least one student-initiated service activity. Or, participate in a trip that includes a community service component. This trip needs to be endorsed by the School. This must be in addition to one or more service activities endorsed by the School.
Complete a self-reflection on the one or more service activities they have participated in which have been endorsed by the School.

6348473f-69a1-45d0-af59-c1442e5819f3.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a commitment to sports coaching. They are able to communicate clearly, plan and run training sessions and matches, organise teams, lead and motivate a team and collaborate with a mentor coach.
6348473f-69a1-45d0-af59-c1442e5819f3.name: Sport Coaching - Netball

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities
alignments.description: This badge aligns with standards from the Australian Curriculum - General Capabilities; Critical and Creative Thinking, Personal and Social Responsibility.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a semester of coaching within the Lauriston Netball Club which has been endorsed by the School.
Attain the Netball Victoria Foundation Community Accreditation
Complete a portfolio of training and match plans, reflections and feedback.

0b109dcc-0bc3-4f36-87dd-2c00744be9f6.description: Earners of the Student Leader: Level 3 badge have completed three or more School years in which they have undertaken a leadership role. They have demonstrated consistent leadership skills & made a measurable contribution as a leader. They have been a mentor to another student with leadership aspirations, or taken responsibility for training other students or taken a lead role in driving one school activity. They have completed a self-reflection on their leadership role/s.
0b109dcc-0bc3-4f36-87dd-2c00744be9f6.name: Student Leader: Level 3

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities
alignments.description: This badge aligns with standards from the Australian Curriculum - General Capabilities; Critical and Creative Thinking, Personal and Social Responsibility.

badge_template_activities.title: Student Leader: Level 2
Awarded a formal leadership role within the School, or voluntarily takes the lead in a School endorsed area.
Completed three or more School years in which they have undertaken a leadership role.
Mentored another student with leadership aspirations, or taken responsibility for training other students or taken a lead role in driving one school activity.
Completes a self reflection that demonstrates what has been learned and achieved. The application includes a reference from a teacher.

7dc74005-6804-4d0c-8c38-34131fb1f028.description: Earners of this badge have completed the, 'Making Artificial Intelligence - Digital Agents' micro course, part of the Lauriston Girls' School micro credentials program. They have demonstrated an introductory understanding of the Google DialogFlow platform and are able to make a simple FAQ chatbot.
7dc74005-6804-4d0c-8c38-34131fb1f028.name: Making Artificial Intelligence - Digital Agents

alignments.name: ISTE Standards for Students: Students as Innovative Designers
alignments.description: 4C: Students develop, test and refine prototypes.

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities: Information and Communication Technology
alignments.description: Communicating with ICT: Students use ICT to share ideas and information to collaboratively construct knowledge and digital solutions. They develop an understanding of the context when communicating using ICT, including a sense of the audience, the form of communication, the techniques used and the characteristics of the users and the technologies.

badge_template_activities.title: Make an FAQ chatbot on the GoogleDialogFlow platform. Demonstrate understanding of Intents, Training Phrases, Responses, and Natural Language Understanding. Iteratively improve chatbot through testing, integration of knowledge bases including from URL's, .CSV and .PDF file types, and implemention of a 'Small Talk' feature to provide a more 'humanistic' interaction with end users.

9824b53a-319b-4b29-94d8-f067aea9d0a8.description: Has represented the School in a minimum of 3 GSV / Extra-Curricular sports (including competition) in Year 12, from the below or 3has contributed to the completion of a School activity that promotes participation in Physical activity.
9824b53a-319b-4b29-94d8-f067aea9d0a8.name: Sport Coaching- Basketball

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a semester of coaching which has been endorsed by the School. Attain the Basketball Victoria Foundation Community Accreditation. Complete a portfolio of training and match plans, reflections and feedback.

e8389b61-df64-439a-af02-e81f0e55e96d.description: Earners of this badge have completed the, 'Making Artificial Intelligence - Machine Learning Models with Teachable Machine' micro course, part of the Lauriston Girls' School micro credentials program. They have demonstrated an introductory understanding of Google's Teachable Machine platform, making machine learning models for image, sound and pose classification. They have created a prototype solution to a real world problem which utilises machine learning.
e8389b61-df64-439a-af02-e81f0e55e96d.name: Making Artificial Intelligence - Machine Learning Models with Teachable Machine

alignments.name: ISTE Standards for Students: Students as Innovative Designers
alignments.description: 4C: Students develop, test and refine prototypes.

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities: Information and Communication Technology
alignments.description: Communicating with ICT: Students use ICT to share ideas and information to collaboratively construct knowledge and digital solutions. They develop an understanding of the context when communicating using ICT, including a sense of the audience, the form of communication, the techniques used and the characteristics of the users and the technologies.

alignments.name: Australian Curriculum: General Capabilities: Information and Communication Technology
alignments.description: Creating with ICT: This element involves students using ICT to realise creative intentions and create solutions to challenges and tasks. In developing and acting with ICT capability, students: generate ideas, plans and processes, and generate solutions to challenges and learning area tasks.

badge_template_activities.title: Make an image classification machine learning model using Google's Teachable Machine. Create a data set, test the model and improve it to increase accuracy.
Make a sound classification machine learning model using Google's Teachable Machine. Create a data set, test the model and improve it to increase accuracy.
Make a body pose classification machine learning model using Google's Teachable Machine. Create a data set, test the model and improve it to increase accuracy.
Make a prototype of a solution to an identified problem, which utilises machine learning.
